metadata.title: CVE-2021-4147 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the libvirt libxl driver. A malicious guest couldcontinuously reboot itself and cause libvirtd on the host to deadlock orcrash, resulting in a denial of service condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4147` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-clients - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-daemon - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-daemon-config-network - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-daemon-config-nwfilter - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-daemon-driver-lxc - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-iscsi-direct - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-daemon-driver-vbox - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-daemon-driver-xen - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-daemon-system - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-daemon-system-systemd - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-daemon-system-sysv - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-login-shell - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-sanlock - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt-wireshark - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
libvirt0 - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.0-1ubuntu7').
